title: Ohms law - resistivity - bar with uniform E field

content.description: A uniform bar is made from a material with resistivity <math alttext="rho" overflow="scroll"><mi>ρ</mi></math>, length <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"> <mi>L</mi> </math>, and cross-sectional area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>. The bar is connected to a battery, which produces a uniform electric field <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> in the bar that is directed to the right, as shown in the figure.
content.question: Which expression is equal to the current in the bar?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction E A over rho" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow><mi>ρ</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction E A over rho L, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>ρ</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction E rho over A" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>ρ</mi></mrow><mi>A</mi></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction E rho L over A" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>ρ</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mi>A</mi></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction E A over rho" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow><mi>ρ</mi></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
